IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We're removing an old substation and replacing it with a new, improved substation. This upgraded substation will enhance the reliability and efficiency of the electricity network in your area. It will also enable new connections to be made, supporting future growth and ensuring a stable electricity supply for homes and businesses in the area. The new equipment will better control and deliver electricity throughout the local network. To connect the new equipment and complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off. Once completed this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in your area and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place on Purley Way.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 19:58 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers have made partial repairs on the underground network in the Bayford Green area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are still on site working on repairs.

With darkness now upon us we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Roland at 18:11.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 16:35 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. We know your power may now be back on, however; we'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 16:54 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers carry out repairs to our network following damage on the underground cable caused by a third party in the Foxglove Road area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Bev, Roland, Theo and Lisa are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 16:38 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Hale Lane area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Hale Lane area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 16:30 and 17:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Roland at 15:15.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 14:46 - We're sorry your power has gone off again. We are sending our engineers back to the Hale Lane area to investigate why.

Currently, our time frame for power to be restored is between 16:30 and 17:30, but once our staff arrive on site and assess the situation, this time may change. As there have been other power cuts recently it's difficult to know what repairs will be needed to restore your power safely, so time frames we provide throughout have to be estimated.

The results of our engineer's tests on our network will let us know if our estimate needs to be adjusted, so we'll update you as soon as they have arrived on site and investigated.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 19:29 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Mangravet Avenue area should now be back on.

I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We believe there may be a fault on our underground electricity cabling in the area, but currently it has not developed to a stage that our staff can pinpoint it. Their tests have proven inconclusive, so for now they have replaced our safety equipment at the substation to get your power back on as quickly as possible.

This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Mangravet Avenue area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame of 23:00 and 00:00 hasn't changed, so I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Lisa at 18:37.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 18:25 - Our staff are on the way to the Mangravet Avenue area as our safety equipment within the nearby substation has operated.

We believe a developing cable fault is causing these repeat power cuts, so while our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 23:00 and 00:00, it's possible this may need to change once staff have assessed. This is because every power cut increases the chance of the fault has developing to a point that our specialist teams can pinpoint it using specialist equipment. I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. Our engineers have been working hard to get you back on and have got a generator set up to be connected to the network. Further materials are needed for this as well as specialist engineers so we now need to send out a relief team first thing in the morning to complete this work for us.
